meanings.definition: To strike (one's toe or foot) against something accidentally.
meanings.sent1: I keep stubbing my toe on the coffee table.
meanings.sent2: She was stubbing her foot on the uneven pavement.
meanings.sent3: He chuckled after stubbing his toe on the door frame.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's movements were like stubbing her toe on invisible obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The pain of stubbing my toe made me jump in surprise.

meanings.definition: A short piece remaining on a stem or branch after a flower or leaf has fallen off.
meanings.sent1: I found a small stubbing on the rose bush.
meanings.sent2: The tree had many stabbings from last season.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the stubbing as a perch to eat its nut.
meanings.sent4: The stubbing on the branch looked like a tiny flag waving.
meanings.sent5: The gardener trimmed the stubbing to promote new growth.
